attributes.additional_details: Parents, particularly Mothers, are run into the ground, trying to manage work, school runs, looking after, teaching and pouring into their children, feeding the kids, mountains of ironing every week, and much much more. If you've ever tried ironing a pleated skirt, you know that it is unnecessarily time consuming, unhelpful and adds extra stress to an already arduous task. Pupils and students should have a choice of a straight skirt, pleated skirt or trousers, by law, to alleviate this stress.
attributes.background: Ban pleated skirts in schools or offer more options by law.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to include specific items of clothing as part of a school uniform are a matter for individual schools, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Require schools to have gender-neutral uniform policies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597731

Ban school uniforms in English schools: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607158
